captions.text: [MUSIC CHARITY VANCE, "Icing."]
-Hey, guys.

I'm Bailey from Cute
Girls Hairstyles,

and today I'm going
to show you guys how

to build a DIY double
fishtail twist.

To start off, you want
to pull all of your hair

to one side of your shoulder,
and then split it in half.

We're going to
take our back half

and pull it out of the
way of our front half

so we can start
our first fishtail.

In case you don't
know how to fishtail,

my mom has a video on it,
but it's pretty basic.

You split your hair
in half, and then you

pull a piece from one
side, pull it across,
blends into the other.

Pull a piece from one side,
across, into the other.

And we're just going to
keep repeating this over

and over until we get
to the end of our braid.
[MUSIC CHARITY VANCE, "Icing."]

-Once you reach the
end of your braid,

I'm just going to take
a smaller rubber band,

and rubber band the
end so it will stay in.

And then we will start
our next fishtail.

You're doing the same thing you
did for your first fishtail.

You just grab a piece,
pull it over, grab a piece,
pull it over.

And we're just going
to keep repeating

like we did the first
braid, until we finish.
[MUSIC CHARITY VANCE, "Icing."]

-Once you finish braiding
both of your fishtails,

you're going to want
to take both of them,

and begin twisting
them together.

But the trick of
this is, you want

to twist them so they're
flat against each other.

So we're going to try and keep
the braids as flat as possible,
and twist them.

As you can see, it makes this
really cool looking braid.

And once you get to
the end of twisting,

you want to take both
of your rubber bands
out of your fishtails.

And I'll just take
one of them and use it
for the end of my braid.
So let's see here.

And don't worry
about it falling out.

If you have really
slick hair, you

can always stick a bobby pin in
between both of your fishtails
to try to get them to stay in.

But mostly they should
stay in because they're
twisted together.

And we are finished
with our braid.

-Don't you guys
love this hairstyle?

Bailey's been wearing it to
school the last couple weeks,

and she get so many
comments on it.

She's telling me about it
all the time, so I'm like,

please film a video
for everybody.
So thank you, Bailey.
-You're welcome.
-Hey, don't forget.

We have some new Mom Minute
episodes over on the Mom's View
channel.

You can check them
out right here.
You can find one of them.

And we will see
you guys next week.
Bye guys.

So busy, and everything is so
easy and convenient these days.

It's much quicker
and faster to just

run through and
grab a Happy Meal,

or to hand a cookie to your
toddler so they'll stop crying.
[MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "Icing.]
-OK, come on.
Here goes Bailey.
-Whoa.
-Here's Brooklyn.
Brooklyn.
Oh, here comes Little
Buddy.
Whoa.
All right.
And here--

title: How to Create a Double Fishtail Twist | #CGHDoubleFishtailTwist
